edu.txstate.pos.storage

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.txstate.pos.storage.Storage

  • public class Storage
extends java.lang.Object
    API for persistent storage for the POS application. This class abstracts the differences in where data is stored - locally or remotely. Activities should get an instance of this object from the POSActvity using the getStorage() method. The setting of the context, deviceID, and logged in user is taken care of when accessed via that method.
    See Also:
    POSActivity

      • login

        public User login(User user)
           throws ConnectionError,
                  NoUserFoundException,
                  BadPasswordException
        Used to check a user's login and password. If the login/password is valid, then a User object is returned with all of the fields populated. Any data passed into the User object is overwritten based on what comes back from the remote storage.
        Parameters:
        user - User object with login and password populated.
        Returns:
        Fully populated user object
        Throws:
        ConnectionError - A network, protocol, server side, or API error
        NoUserFoundException
        BadPasswordException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The same User object with the User ID populated
        Throws:

        UserExistsException

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String login)
                throws ConnectionError,
                       NoUserFoundException
        Deletes the user associated with the given login.
        Parameters:
        login - The login to delete.
        Throws:
        ConnectionError - A network, protocol, server side or API error
        NoUserFoundException

      • updateUser

        public void updateUser(User user)
                throws ConnectionError,
                       NoUserFoundException
        Update a user record. If there is no userID in the User object, then the record is looked up by the login record. If there is a userID, then the record to be updated is looked up by the userID. This implies that if the login is to be updated, then the userID needs to be passed in.
        Parameters:
        user - User object containing the new values for a user
        Throws:
        ConnectionError - A network, protocol, server side, or API error
        NoUserFoundException - The user record wasn't found.
